intro: Ctenium nukaviense, commonly known as the Nukavu ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the island of Nukahiva in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, coastal environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
